title: Revert operation takes significantly longer than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When working in the Java editor, I noticed that the revert operation is much slower compared to the close and reopen approach. To reproduce the issue, follow the steps provided below.
OB:
1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR:
1. Open the Java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Save the changes without closing the file.
4. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
5. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6. Observe the time taken to open the file again using the reopening approach.
7. Repeat steps 2) to 4).
8. Right-click on the file in the editor and select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu.
9. Observe the time taken to revert the contents of the file in the editor.
